channel.title: How to char comparison queries with % variation
channel.description:
Hi,
I am currently working on a `query runner` for `NewRelic` and have successfully implemented `count` and `comparison` queries.
I am facing an issue in visualization. I am not sure how to chart the `comparison` query, the query returns two records `usually previous and current with count`.
What will be the best method to chart this data. Also is there any visualization that can show `percentage % variation` in the two records. Something like `x% up or down based on current and previous records`.
This can help different type of data also.
Regards, Mudasir Mirza.

Hi,

I am currently working on a query runner for NewRelic and have successfully implemented count and comparison queries.

I am facing an issue in visualization. I am not sure how to chart the comparison query, the query returns two records usually previous and current with count.

What will be the best method to chart this data. Also is there any visualization that can show percentage % variation in the two records.
Something like x% up or down based on current and previous records.

This can help different type of data also.
